notes.suttacentral_structure: SuttaCentral bilara-data uses JSON files with segment IDs as keys. Each file contains translation segments for a specific sutta.

traditions.Theravada: Pali Canon - oldest Buddhist texts, focused on individual liberation
traditions.Mahayana: Later Buddhist tradition emphasizing compassion and bodhisattva path
traditions.Vajrayana: Tantric Buddhism, especially prominent in Tibet, uses mantras and visualizations

major_sutras_not_included.Diamond_Sutra: Available in CBETA Chinese Buddhist corpus (cbeta-org/xml-p5)
major_sutras_not_included.Lotus_Sutra: Available in CBETA Chinese Buddhist corpus (cbeta-org/xml-p5)
major_sutras_not_included.Lankavatara_Sutra: Available in CBETA Chinese Buddhist corpus (cbeta-org/xml-p5)
major_sutras_not_included.Vimalakirti_Sutra: Available in CBETA Chinese Buddhist corpus (cbeta-org/xml-p5)

data_format_notes.suttacentral_json: Format: {"segment_id": "English text", ...}. Example: {"mn1:1.1": "So I have heard."}
data_format_notes.chinese_txt: Format: Alternating lines of Pinyin and Chinese characters. Line 1: Title in Pinyin, Line 2: Title in Chinese

future_expansions: Add CBETA Mahayana sutras (Diamond, Lotus, etc.) - requires XML/TEI parsing
Add Tibetan Buddhist texts from BDRC (buda-base) - requires EWTS parsing
Add more complete Pali Canon from SuttaCentral
Add Sanskrit Buddhist texts from Digital Sanskrit Buddhist Canon

dharmic_repositories_researched.contents: Bhagavad Gita (18 chapters), Rigveda (10 mandalas), Yajurveda, Atharvaveda (20 kaandas), Valmiki Ramayana (7 kaandas), Ramcharitmanas
dharmic_repositories_researched.format: JSON with Sanskrit text, transliterations, and multiple translations
dharmic_repositories_researched.notes: Comprehensive collection, all files in structured JSON format

dharmic_repositories_researched.contents: Pali Canon (Tipitaka) - all major Buddhist suttas including Dhammapada, Metta Sutta, etc.
dharmic_repositories_researched.notes: Complex structure with root/, translation/, html/ directories. Each text has unique segment IDs. Would require custom integration.
Less clear structure, would need investigation of actual file formats

notes.implementation_decision: Using bhavykhatri/DharmicData as primary source due to consistent JSON structure, comprehensive coverage of Hindu scriptures, and active maintenance. Buddhist texts from suttacentral/bilara-data would require significant custom integration work due to their complex segment-based structure and should be considered for future enhancement.
